@description.name: @description
@description.body:
This class provides unified key event handler for Internet Explorer,
Firefox, Opera and Safari.

NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a new instance

@param.name: @param
@param.body: manager {qx.event.Manager} Event manager for the window to use
@param.description: Event manager for the window to use

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {var} The target to, which the event handler should
be attached
@param.description:
The target to, which the event handler should
be attached

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} event type
@param.description: event type

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event handler can handle events of the
given type.
@return.desc:
Whether the event handler can handle events of the
given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {var} The target to, which the event handler should
be attached
@param.description:
The target to, which the event handler should
be attached

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} event type
@param.description: event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
target {var} The target from, which the event handler should
be removed
@param.description:
The target from, which the event handler should
be removed

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} event type
@param.description: event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fire a key input event with the given parameters

@param.name: @param
@param.body: domEvent {Event} DOM event
@param.description: DOM event

@param.name: @param
@param.body: charCode {Integer} character code
@param.description: character code

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fire a key up/down/press event with the given parameters

@param.name: @param
@param.body: domEvent {Event} DOM event
@param.description: DOM event

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} type og the event
@param.description: type og the event

@param.name: @param
@param.body: keyIdentifier {String} key identifier
@param.description: key identifier

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the target element for key events

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initializes the native key event listeners.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops the native key event listeners.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Low level handler for "keyup" and "keydown" events

@param.name: @param
@param.body: domEvent {Event} DOM event object
@param.description: DOM event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
some keys like "up", "down", "pageup", "pagedown" do not bubble a
"keypress" event in Firefox. To work around this bug we attach keypress
listeners directly to the input events.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=467513

@param.name: @param
@param.body: target {Element} The event target
@param.description: The event target

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} The event type
@param.description: The event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: keyCode {Integer} the key code
@param.description: the key code

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Low level key press handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body: domEvent {Event} DOM event object
@param.description: DOM event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Key handler for an idealized browser.
Runs after the browser specific key handlers have normalized the key events.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: keyCode {String} keyboard code
@param.description: keyboard code

@param.name: @param
@param.body: charCode {String} character code
@param.description: character code

@param.name: @param
@param.body: eventType {String} type of the event (keydown, keypress, keyup)
@param.description: type of the event (keydown, keypress, keyup)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: domEvent {Element} DomEvent
@param.description: DomEvent

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Map} maps the charcodes of special keys for key press emulation

@description.name: @description
@description.body: converts a key identifier back to a keycode

@param.name: @param
@param.body: keyIdentifier {String} The key identifier to convert
@param.description: The key identifier to convert

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.desc:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The bind method delegates the call to the
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current
object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: targetProperty {String} The property name of the target object.
@param.description: The property name of the target object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map} A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
{@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.desc:
A promise which is resolved when the initial value
has been set on the target.  Note that this does NOT resolve when subsequent
values are returned.  The promise value is the internal id for that binding.
The id can be used for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not
an atomic id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
there is no property definition for object and property (source and
target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The
id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.desc:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object
and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
usually falls back to a default, which is the target
by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the
listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.desc:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.desc: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by
{@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.desc: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.desc: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create an event object and dispatch it on this object.
The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you
are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
{@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.desc:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets multiple properties at once by using a property list or
sets one property and its value by the first and second argument.
As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a
handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Map | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.desc: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be
found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Resets the value of the given property. If no generated resetter could be
found, a handwritten resetter will be invoked, if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property.
@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Checks if the property is initialized, i.e. has a defined init value or
has got a value by a setter method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: prop {String} Name of the property
@param.description: Name of the property

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the condition evaluates to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: condition {var} Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Raise an {@link AssertionError}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: compact {Boolean} Show less verbose message. Default: false.
@param.description: Show less verbose message. Default: false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the value is true (Identity check).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} Condition to check for. Must be identical to true.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must be identical to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the value is false (Identity check).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {Boolean} Condition to check for. Must be identical to false.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must be identical to false.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are equal. (Uses the equality operator ==.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are not equal. (Uses the not equality operator !=.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Assert that both float values are equal. This might be needed because
of the natural floating point inaccuracy of computers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {Float} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {Float} Found value
@param.description: Found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Assert that both float values are not equal. This might be needed
because of the natural floating point inaccuracy of computers.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {Float} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {Float} Found value
@param.description: Found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are identical. (Uses the identity operator ===.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: found {var} found value
@param.description: found value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that both values are not identical. (Uses the not identity operator !==.)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: expected {var} Reference value
@param.description: Reference value
